Thanks Joe.
After rereading my question and your answer, I did arrive at a
working solution of placing the reused class within the TestCase and
thus 'within reach' of the methods that form my tests. I did need it
to be static and didn't intially conceive that JUnit invokes all the
testXXX methods in quick succession (In their own threads?), this did
cause some 'interesting' contention issues within the reused object
(resolved with the addition of a small synchronisation block). The
sync issue means some more tests are needed. Oh joy 8).

--- Mark
